meanings.definition: To shout loudly in anger or excitement.
meanings.sent1: She was yelling at her brother for breaking her toy.
meanings.sent2: The fans were yelling with joy when their team scored a goal.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started yelling back at the noisy kids in the park.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to be yelling warnings from the sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's yelling could be heard all the way down the hallway.

meanings.sent1: His yelling could be heard across the field.
meanings.sent2: The baby's yelling woke up the entire household.
meanings.sent3: The yelling of the monkeys in the zoo made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sirens added to the chaos of the city's yelling.
meanings.sent5: The yelling of the protesters echoed through the streets.
